content:
Emirates is a great choice! Their in-flight entertainment system, known as ice, is indeed one of the best in the sky. With over 4,000 channels of entertainment, including movies, TV shows, music, and games, you'll never be bored on a long-haul flight.

However, keep in mind that Emirates might not be the most direct option for flying to Japan. Emirates operates flights from various destinations to Tokyo (NRT/HND) and Osaka (KIX) with layovers in Dubai (DXB). While their hub in Dubai is a great place to break up the journey, it might add some extra travel time to your overall journey.

If you do decide to fly with Emirates, you can expect:

* A wide selection of movies, including the latest releases and classic films
* A vast music library with thousands of songs
* A range of TV shows, including popular series and documentaries
* Games and interactive content
* A generous baggage allowance, especially if you're flying in Business or First Class
* Delicious meals and drinks, with a focus on Middle Eastern and international cuisine

That being said, if you're set on flying with Emirates, you can still enjoy their excellent in-flight entertainment system and lounge facilities in Dubai. Just be sure to check the layover duration and plan accordingly to make the most of your stopover.

Now, if you're still undecided between Japan Airlines, ANA, and Emirates, here are some questions to consider:

* Are you looking for a more direct flight to Japan, or are you open to a layover in Dubai or another city?
* How important is in-flight entertainment to you, and are you willing to compromise on other aspects of the flight experience?
* What's your budget for the flight, and which airline offers the best value for your money?

Let me know if you have any other questions or concerns, and I'll do my best to help you make an informed decision!
